newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks end higher, eye of U.S. data.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks end higher, eye of U.S. data.

text.p: Toronto stocks finished higher on Wednesday, rising along with Wall Street ahead of key U.S. economic data due out later this week.
The TSE 300 Composite Index rose 13.29 points to close at 5160.41 in turnover of 96.98 million shares valued at C$1.17 billion ($853 million).
Advancing stocks outnumbered declines 479 to 394 with 302 issues ending flat.
Ira Katzin, an investment adviser with Richardson Greenshields of Canada Ltd., said investors are concerned that signs of a slowing U.S. economy will mean weaker corporate earnings.
"But offsetting that is the feeling that if the U.S. economy is slowing down, then interest rates will ease off a little bit," Katzin said.
He added the picture will become clearer with U.S. consumer and producer price data due on Thursday and Friday.
Toronto's 14 sub-groups were evenly split. The energy group led the strong side, adding 53 points after oil prices rallied on news that Iraq fired missiles at U.S. jets today.
October Brent closed up US$0.70 at US$23.59 per barrel after earlier reaching post-Gulf War highs.
* Gulf Canada Resources Ltd. closed up 0.45 at 8.90, a new 52-week high. Takeovers also pushed several oil stocks higher.
Morgan Hydrocarbons Inc. added 0.25 to 4.35 after the company said it has received unsolicited expressions of interest.
Gardiner Oil & Gas Ltd. jumped 2.20 to 11.70 after the company agreed ot a friendly takeover bid from Poco Petroleums Ltd. late Tuesday.
* Fairfax Financial Holdings Ltd. continued its recent climb after a major acquisition. Fairfax soared 13 to 250, a new high.
* In the loss column, Molson Cos Ltd. class A fell 0.30 to 20.20 after brewer said it is not considering a share buyback despite shareholder pressure.
